Package Controller

Class Customers

java.lang.Object
Controller.Customers
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class Customers extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This is the controller class for the Customers screen. This class contains methods to initialize the customer table with data from the Customer DAO class. It also contains methods to load the CustomersAdd screen when the user clicks the Add button and to delete a customer when the user clicks the Delete button.
Author:
Mehdi Rahimi

  • Method Details

    • onActionAddCustomer

      void onActionAddCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      When the user clicks the "Add Customer" button, switch to the "CustomersAdd.fxml" screen.
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggered the switch.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the file cannot be found.

    • onActionDeleteCustomer

      void onActionDeleteCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws Exception
      If a customer is selected, confirm that the user wants to delete the customer, then if the customer has appointments, confirm that the user wants to delete the appointments, then delete the appointments, then delete the customer
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggered the method. @LAMBDA expression used to delete the customer and appointments. It facilitates the use of the foreach loop to delete the appointments inside a try/catch block to catch any SQLExceptions.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the customer cannot be deleted.

    • deleteCustomer

      private void deleteCustomer(Customer customer)
      The function takes a customer object as a parameter, and then calls the deleteCustomer function in the CustomerDaoImpl class. If the function is successful, it will show an information dialog box, and if it fails, it will show an error dialog box
      Parameters:
      customer - The customer object to be deleted.

    • onActionModifyCustomer

      void onActionModifyCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      When the user clicks the "Modify Customer" button, switch to the Customers Modify screen. If no customer is selected, shows an error dialog box.
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggered the switch.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the file cannot be found.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Theis function is the initialize function. It is called when the FXML file is loaded. It sets the cell value factory for each column in the Customers table view. It also sets the items in the table view to the list of customers returned by the getAllCustomers function in the CustomerDaoImpl class.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resourceBundle - This is a ResourceBundle object that contains the resources for the application.
